--- Beno�t BENATAR <bentiger@...> wrote:

> From: Beno�t BENATAR <bentiger@...>
> To: shinsengumihq@...
> Date: Wed, 08 Dec 2004 18:59:08 +0100
> 
> Greetings,
> 
> My name is Benoit Benatar.
> 
> I and our community are originally from France and
> we have a common interest 
> in the Shinsengumi, we often visit your site with
> interest.
> 
> We try to make a video game be importated in Europe,
> this game is in 
> connection with the Wolves of Mibu, the game is
> called "Fu-Un Shinsengumi". 
> But this release will exclusivly remain in Japan if
> we don't react. We 
> require assistance.
> 
> In this inovating game, we control a group of the
> famous samurais working 
> for Shogun. As you know, the story is held about
> 1865 before the end of the 
> Tokugawa era. Gameplay, scenario, combat, realism,
> graphics are awesome.
> 
> In the following link, you can see our official
> website. There are two 
> trailers and some banners that can be used in news,
> for example.
> 
> http://membres.lycos.fr/shinsen/
> 
> A news, an advertizing, an article in your site to
> make known our movement 
> will be greatly appreciated by us, if you accept to
> post one, of course. 
> Here is a link to the free and legal petition; do
> you want to speak about it 
> in latters posts so as to invit people to sign it?
> 
> http://www.PetitionOnline[...]amoto/petition.html
> 
> 
> This game isn't the only reason that we started up
> this petition, we also 
> try to promote the japanese culture and masterpieces
> in Europe that wouldn't 
> be released here if we don't act.
> 
> Our action is not hopeless, Genki Corporation is
> surprised by our will (We 
> remain in negotiation with them), and we gathered
> more than 1000 signatures. 
> But currently, it remains doubtful as for the future
> of the European release 
> of "Fu-un Shinsengumi", thus, your assistance will
> be welcome.
> 
> We hope a positive reply from you and wish you an
> excellent continuation.
> 
> Good bye !
> 
> The French Community for the release of "Fu-un
> Shinsengumi" in Europe
> 
>
